Description: Lower body and foot sherd of Corinthian, possibly black-glazed, pottery kotyle; very worn; interior: glazed (fired brown and only traces remaining); exterior: painted decoration consisting of the base of four rays rising from narrow band above foot; band on outer and inner face of foot; pair of narrow bands on underside.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.246) (phase 3)
